title: Fix calculate-elbow Call
description: Fixes bug in calculate-elbow logic for schematic traces by mapping facingDirection values to expected string values, resolving incorrect SVG generation for schematic traces.
body: This PR fixes a bug in the calculate-elbow logic for schematic traces by explicitly mapping the facingDirection values ("right", "left", "up", "down") to the expected "x+", "x-", "y+", and "y-" string values. Previously, the wrong facingDirection values caused the trace routing engine to miscalculate elbow segments, producing incorrect schematic SVGs. The issue was exposed by example28-elbow, where netlabels like SCL and SDA failed to connect properly through the solder jumper. Example of what was generated before this fix:

https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_6881c10f3b30832eb100d66caff4397b

title: Fix: Remove incorrect junctions on schematic traces
description: Fixes incorrect junction placement on schematic traces due to floating-point precision issues, ensuring junctions only appear at actual intersections between traces.
body:
### Problem
Schematic traces were displaying junction circles at incorrect locations, specifically at JP9 pin 1 in the test case. Junctions were appearing at connection points rather than only at actual intersections between traces.

### Root Cause
The intersection detection logic had floating-point precision issues when determining if edges were vertical or horizontal. This caused false intersection detection between edges that didn't actually cross each other.

### Solution
Added a tolerance-based approach (0.001mm) for floating-point comparisons when detecting edge orientations. This ensures that edges that are very close to being vertical/horizontal are properly identified, preventing false intersection detection.

Specific test case (example27) now shows correct junction placement

#1089
